column1: As COVID-19 cases surge we must stay vigilant in the fight to keep ourselves and our loved ones healthy.   Take a look at the updated California guidelines to ensure your household has a plan for staying safe this holiday season. https://t.co/DUGRqD6B5H

Especially as we're seeing rising COVID-19 cases it is crucial to protect yourself and your family this flu season. @ochealth  is providing free drive-thru and walk-up flu shots for ages 3+ by appointment. Learn more here:  https://t.co/7epBwP8Wci

Today I was honored to celebrate the new Huntington Beach Navigation Center the first homeless shelter in the city. At a time when so many are facing heightened struggles due to COVID-19 I am proud that our community is working to connect people with the support they need. https://t.co/jnamnasMmp

As you make plans for the holiday weekend make sure to follow health and safety guidelines to protect yourself your loved ones and our most vulnerable populations from COVID-19. https://t.co/crv7OMmkuY

Over 1800 firefighters have risked their lives to battle the #SilveradoFire & #BlueRidgeFire. On this #NationalFirstRespondersDay join me in thanking all the brave individuals working tirelessly to safeguard our communities from fires COVID-19 & every emergency situation. https://t.co/EQgIkd35MB

The CARES Act continues to provide critical assistance to Orange County residents struggling with COVID-related hardship. It is essential that we keep fighting to extend this vital relief – the health and prosperity of our communities depend on it.   https://t.co/qwQORceWT4

The COVID-19 pandemic presents an unprecedented stressor to the millions of Americans that already struggle with mental illness. This #MentalIllnessAwarenessWeek join me in spreading awareness and support as we fight to end the stigma.  https://t.co/simNpzpklL

This week I was honored to visit several small businesses that make Little Saigon the incredible community it is. We must continue to support our local economies as Orange County fights #COVID19 and recovers from this crisis. https://t.co/9qfPjzc3uj

Thank you teachers for giving Orange County students joy education and structure during the coronavirus crisis.   Happy #WorldTeachersDay to those shaping and inspiring young minds. Have you thanked a teacher today?

Where was this "whatever it takes" energy for passing the #HeroesAct? The House passed a COVID-19 bill in MAY that would have saved thousands of lives & millions of livelihoods.  @senatemajldr & @SenRonJohnson sat on their hands. No will to save lives but moon suits for SCOTUS. https://t.co/G5h9NKEcBq

I wish the President First Lady and White House staff a speedy recovery. It is abundantly clear that #COVID19 will continue sowing discord disaster and death across the United States until we ACT.   Please wear your mask and stay safe.
Orange County is losing lives and livelihoods to the coronavirus — we need the updated #HeroesAct NOW.   Here's what this emergency legislation would mean for #CA48: https://t.co/6EU7pXV33b

They are voting "NO" on a bill that helps working families small businesses and local governments SURVIVE during the coronavirus crisis.   Call your Representative at (202) 224-3121 and tell them to vote "YES" on the updated #HeroesAct. (6/6)

California is facing two public health crises at the same time: COVID-19 and the opioid epidemic.  I teamed up with @RepMullin @Sen_JoeManchin & @SenToomey to fight substance abuse in our communities and prevent fatal drug overdoses. https://t.co/X1iSJ4j6ey

Wishing @RepJahanaHayes her family and staff a speedy recovery.  We need a national testing strategy and we need it NOW.  As Rep. Hayes said without rapid #COVID19 testing “this level of anxiety and uncertainty is untenable.” https://t.co/rRaUsdNSPP

At the end of April 60000 Americans had died from #COVID19. Today almost 190000 Americans have been killed by the coronavirus.  The White House and @realDonaldTrump have failed the American people. It didn't have to be this bad. https://t.co/IR4FyOkCmK

This #NationalRecoveryMonth we're battling two health emergencies: COVID-19 & addiction.   I introduced bipartisan legislation to support substance abuse prevention programs during the pandemic. We must pass this bill to keep our communities #DrugFree https://t.co/bTtZl7yvdL

I visited the Orange County Fire Authority to speak with Chief Fennessy & his team about wildfire season. Thank you to our first responders who are battling #COVID19 and wildfires across California. https://t.co/oLB51zITZN

During the coronavirus crisis over 40% of U.S. adults have reported they are struggling with their mental health or substance abuse. You are not alone. #WorldSuicidePreventionDay2020 https://t.co/Cm8sst9p4h

I questioned Dr. Fauci at an @OversightDems hearing on March 11th have been pushing for #COVID19 mitigation measures ever since.   Dr. Fauci knew #TrumpKnew and my colleagues across the aisle knew the severity of the coronavirus.  It didn't have to be this bad. https://t.co/zGyUZbcYzX

California is battling the coronavirus and climate change. It's a deadly mix of crises for millions especially our first responders.   Our nation's disaster preparedness plan? Remove any/all mentions of climate change from @FEMA documents and hope for the best. https://t.co/8kAunpGywE
Today I'm thinking about the workers who built our nation and the workers keeping our nation running during #COVID19.   American workers deserve safety equity and dignity on #LaborDay and every day.
Masks work so remember to #WorkYourMask this weekend to protect your family neighbors and community from #COVID19.

.@senatemajldr's refusal to pass additional emergency COVID-19 funding is putting our students teachers and communities at risk as they return to school.   Protecting the health and safety of our children is bigger than petty partisan politics. It's past time to pass the bill. https://t.co/SVqa7Ce5FJ

ATTN OC: #COVID19 testing is now available at the OC Fairgrounds. This long-anticipated site funded by federal $$ is a model for communities struggling to contain #COVID19.  We can beat this virus with testing masking social distancing and leadership. https://t.co/po1LjiRYUv

THREAD: With 175000+ Americans dead from #COVID19 continuing attacks on our democracy and constant injustice on our screens like the horrific shooting of #JacobBlake — it's easy to feel powerless. Here are some things you can do to make a difference: (1/x)

170000 Americans are dead. Friends parents neighbors co-workers teachers children...  ...and @realDonaldTrump and his son-in-law are calling America's horrific #COVID19 response a "success." https://t.co/ZH7AkZYHjH

Community providers like @ShareOurSelves are on the frontlines of the coronavirus crisis working 24/7 to keep OC healthy. Their new mobile unit is an incredible step to ensure OC's most vulnerable can access health services during #COVID19 and beyond. https://t.co/0HH0gdikoX

FEMA's Admin testified before my @OversightDems Subcommittee and thanked Congress for fully funding FEMA to "make sure that we are ready for whatever disaster comes to us."  Now @RealDonaldTrump is planning to ransack FEMA $$ during #COVID19 & an UNPRECEDENTED disaster season. https://t.co/S2KixGPuPg

Women are keeping our nation running during #COVID19. My office is hosting the first annual #CA48 Women of Excellence Awards to honor OC's incredible women and celebrate 100 years of women voting. Visit https://t.co/6vZWpCv770 to submit a nomination by August 10th. https://t.co/vpd8cGKYIn

Where’s your plan for getting your Members to wear face masks?   Where’s your plan for speaking out against President Trump and his failed #COVID19 leadership?  Where’s your plan to help working families and small businesses?  Where’s your decency? https://t.co/W4UXnWgoar
150000 Americans have died from #COVID19 and the Trump Administration is preventing qualified doctoral students from saving lives because...they are foreign. https://t.co/GiRkYVGvGz

My wife Kaira & I have four children and cannot imagine how hard the coronavirus crisis has been on parents with young kids.   I’m proud to support the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act & the Child Care is Essential Act to help #SaveChildCare. https://t.co/eHyXNNhDMv

#PFAS exposure which weakens immune systems causes diseases like cancer and is reported to reduce antibody responses to vaccines could create the perfect #COVID19 storm in communities across the United States. @HHSGov must study this relationship ASAP. https://t.co/XJ9acL0ein

I wish my colleague a speedy recovery from #COVID19.   I hope staff members and journalists who were in contact with Mr. Gohmert while he refused to wear a mask are healthy & #COVID19 free. https://t.co/4GVOdjve4M
Want the latest #COVID19 updates? Looking for information about Orange County reopenings? Subscribe to my newsletter! Updates are sent by email OR text. https://t.co/6SyHlJsd6X

Good morning! At 9:00 am EST I'll be chairing an @OversightDems hearing questioning @FEMA_Pete on his agency's preparedness to respond to anticipated natural disasters such as hurricanes flooding and wildfires...amid the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Pd6I03ERHd

I've said it before and I'll say it again — #WearAMask to protect public health and help our economy. It's critical that we come together as a community to fight #COVID19 by wearing masks practicing social distancing and washing our hands. https://t.co/hl2LhXfgn8
Good. Moving forward I hope this Administration spends less time creating xenophobic policies and more time fighting the coronavirus. https://t.co/i57c6sazCi

2) Re: the erroneous addition of serology tests to OC #COVID19 testing numbers...how was this error discovered? When was the Board notified of this error? Why did it take WEEKS (and a newspaper article) to notify the delegation and the public? (3/x) https://t.co/4EUWVNkXEI

1) The County has committed funds provided by the CARES Act for testing PPE disease control food assistance and other #COVID19 related expenses. How has the County used such funds and how does the County plan to use remaining funds? (2/x)

THREAD: #COVID19 is out of control in Orange County.   The OC congressional delegation and I sent a letter to the OC Board of Supervisors expressing our strong concerns regarding their use of federal $$ to prevent test trace treat and limit COVID-19. We have questions. (1/x) https://t.co/FX9XoiFtAY

Today @RepTedBudd and I introduced the bipartisan Drug-Free Communities Pandemic Relief Act. This critical bill would help ensure Drug-Free Communities coalitions can continue to operate and reduce youth substance use during #COVID19. https://t.co/bTtZl7yvdL

If @RealDonaldTrump wants to talk about the economy let's talk about the economy during #COVID19.   We can't have a healthy economy without healthy people.  We can't have a healthy economy without childcare.  We can't have a healthy economy without homeowner/renter assistance.

My bipartisan Helping Businesses Reopen Safely Act of 2020 provides a tax credit to purchase PPE + other supplies to mitigate the spread of #COVID19.   Small business owners should not be financially penalized for providing safe and clean service. https://t.co/srrZTkXqtV

ATTN: This order applies to Orange County.   Businesses will still be able to operate outdoor and take-out service.  Wear your mask to slow the spread of #COVID19 protect public health and help our economy. https://t.co/1oUYP6jCj8

Today I introduced the bipartisan Helping Businesses Reopen Safely Act of 2020 which provides a tax credit to purchase PPE + other supplies to mitigate the spread of #COVID19.  Small business owners should not be financially penalized for providing safe and clean service. https://t.co/oDoWQ1tbua

I'm in D.C. to work #ForThePeople. This week Congress will consider bills to:  🏥Protect and lower health care costs 🏠Provide emergency relief to homeowners severely impacted by #COVID19 💳Improve credit score transparency 🚧Rebuild and modernize our crumbling infrastructure https://t.co/YrgJ4XzmGG

Today I joined @newportchamber of Commerce President Steve Rosansky to hear directly from local small business owners who are struggling during #COVID19. Small businesses are the backbone of our nation — we must ensure they can survive the coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/w6yjwC4w1W

The President of the United States has confirmed that he ordered his administration to slow down testing.   122000 Americans have died.  As cases spike across the nation many more will die.   Not only is @RealDonaldTrump failing to contain #COVID19 — he's SLOWING DOWN TESTING. https://t.co/h7wzat27P8

#COVID19 cases are on the rise. If we fail to use face masks we risk accelerating community spread. We risk seeing our hospitals exhaust their resources. We risk Orange County (and communities across the U.S.) being forced to shelter at home…again. (4/x) https://t.co/bfI4mua1xx

Face masks allow small biz owners to keep their lights on/employees on their payroll. Two hairstylists tested positive for #COVID19 after serving 140 clients while unknowingly contagious. Not a single customer contracted #COVID19. How? Face masks. (3/x) https://t.co/f145OtFJ5x

A recent study from researchers compared #COVID19 infection rate trends in Italy and New York before and after face masks were made mandatory. They found that mandatory mask orders prevented more than 78000 infections in Italy and 66000 in NYC. (2/x) https://t.co/pDhJndF74M

The United States had its first confirmed #COVID19 case on January 20th. It’s now June 20th and we STILL don’t have:  - a testing/tracing strategy  - adequate PPE - clear nationwide guidance   118000+ Americans have died. https://t.co/pLK0bvFFEW
Throughout the coronavirus crisis we have been working #ForThePeople. Even via WebEx I will continue fighting for working families and small businesses across Orange County. (3/3)

Today @RepBrianMast and I introduced the bipartisan Fairness for Early Withdrawers Act which would allow older Americans to re-contribute retirement funds during #COVID19. I'll keep fighting to ensure our seniors can survive the coronavirus crisis without risking their savings.

Researchers who have been criminally underfunded for decades are working around to clock to develop #COVID19 treatments.   We must invest NOW in STEAM to protect public health + protect America's storied commercial innovation for generations to come. (3/3)
